result.execSummary:
The defendant Lonell Echols was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the amounts of:  $14.46 payable to victim Debra H.; and $10.00 payable to victim Janice B.  Joint and several with coactors George  Eskridge 15CF2286 and Brian Echols 15CF2287.

Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges, each count.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with the victims or their families.
No possession of firearms or weapons of any kind.
Comply with the standard rules of Extended supervision.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment. Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never psosess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.
*Court finds defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program if deemed appropriate by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as conditions in count one.

Defendant's pro se motion to enforce judgment of conviction.  (Return Address:  Lonell Echols #588808, Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 282, Plymouth, WI  53073).

per order dated  September 15, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP1275CR, IT IS ORDERED that the motion is denied. The 30-day period in which to file a petition for review may not be enlarged. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED the motion itself shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review. However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by October 16, 2017. If the statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed. No further time extension will be granted.

records.addlTxt: to Judge Donald; from the victim, Debra H. - filed.
Associated with Charge #1
Letter from Defendant

Defendant Lonell Echols in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Lonell Echols in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:   The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 12-1/2 YEARS, concurrent to Count #2, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 7-1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS. 
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS, concurrent to Count #1, and consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.   
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.
Credit given for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program , IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

CONDITIONS FOR EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2):  
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victims or their families.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fees,  and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $14.46 payable to the victim, Debra H. - JOINT & SEVERAL with the co-actors, George Eskridge (15CF2286) and Brian Echols (15CF2287).  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $10.00 payable to the victim, Janice B. - JOINT & SEVERAL with the co-actors, George Eskridge (15CF2286) and Brian Echols (15CF2287).  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* No possession of firearms or weapons of any kind.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Defendant's Letter of Apology.

Defendant Lonell Echols in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Lonell Echols in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Lonell Echols in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Lonell Echols in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Lonell Echols in court with attorney Brian B. Burke.  Defendant Lonell Echols in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
